snippet: Ukraine continues to dominate public discourse in Russia, and nothing else — not housing concerns, political issues or even an indoor smoking ban — really competes.
abstract: Memo From Russia; fact that the annexation of Crimea has infused Russians with a sense of greatness they had lost has sent Pres Vladimir Putin's ratings soaring; Ukraine is dominating public discourse, with the government line--granting some measure of autonomy for the East and protecting the Russian language--dominating the discussion.

byline.contributor: Alexandra Odynova contributed reporting from Moscow.

lead_paragraph: Ukraine continues to dominate public discourse in Russia, and nothing else — not housing concerns, political issues or even an indoor smoking ban — really competes.

headline.main: After Annexing Crimea, Euphoric Russia Turns Thoughts to Ukraine
headline.print_headline: After Annexing Crimea, Euphoric Russia Turns Thoughts to Ukraine
